alert.note: Alert for Collier (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 5:41PM EDT until September 29 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Collier and Mainland Monroe. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain with feeder bands developing over the Gulf waters and moving northward into southeast Collier County. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen over this area during the last couple of hours from the feeder bands. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning will be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Everglades City, Carnestown, Plantation Island, Copeland, Big Cypress National Preserve, Everglades National Park and Port Of The Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
